meanings.definition: A projecting corner or angle of a building.
meanings.sent1: The bird built its nest in the coigne of the old house.
meanings.sent2: I sat on the coigne of the building, enjoying the view.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat got stuck in the coigne and needed help to get out.
meanings.sent4: The coigne of the building jutted out like a welcoming arm.
meanings.sent5: The coigne provided a perfect spot for the squirrel to hide its acorns.

meanings.definition: A wedge-shaped stone at the corner of a building.
meanings.sent1: The ancient coigne was weathered but still held the building together.
meanings.sent2: I tripped over the coigne and almost fell.
meanings.sent3: The children used the coigne as a base in their game of tag.
meanings.sent4: The coigne stood out like a puzzle piece in the wall.
meanings.sent5: The coigne was chiseled with intricate patterns, adding beauty to the building.

meanings.definition: A projecting part of a fortification.
meanings.sent1: The soldiers hid behind the coigne, waiting for the enemy.
meanings.sent2: The coigne provided protection to those inside the fort.
meanings.sent3: The coigne was so high that even the tallest ladder couldn't reach it.
meanings.sent4: The coigne loomed over the battlefield like a guardian.
meanings.sent5: The coigne was strategically placed to overlook the entire valley.
